thread.title: Lin-Manuel Miranda: 'Hamilton' mixtape coming

title: Lin-Manuel Miranda: 'Hamilton' mixtape coming
text:
Lin-Manuel Miranda has more 'Hamilton' music to share. (Photo: Charles Sykes, Charles Sykes/Invision/AP)
CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE First, Hamilton was a single rap presented to President Obama . Then, it was an off-Broadway show. After that, is moved on to become the hottest ticket in the Great White Way. And recently, the hip-hop soundtrack from Lin-Manuel Miranda's musical became available.
But that's not all.
Miranda shared on Twitter that he's going to release a mixtape of Hamilton music.
So the show is done.
Cast album is out.
Now we begin planning The Hamilton Mixtape.
Remixes & Covers & Inspired bys.
FOR REAL.
GET READY.
— Lin-Manuel Miranda (@Lin_Manuel) October 1, 2015 The librettist and star said he actually wanted to release the mixtape before Hamilton opened, but that didn't pan out.
I was originally trying to get the mixtape done with Atlantic before we opened, but that's like performing surgery while having a baby.
— Lin-Manuel Miranda (@Lin_Manuel) October 1, 2015 Miranda said fans can expect remixes, covers a never-heard rap battle and maybe "my demo."
& then there's the cut third, rap battle, that none of you have heard, where Ham, Mad & Jeff go IN on slavery.
Might just release my demo.
— Lin-Manuel Miranda (@Lin_Manuel) October 1, 2015 But just you wait until next year.
This is all for early next year. Need time to get my brains back.
— Lin-Manuel Miranda (@Lin_Manuel) October 1, 2015 In the meantime, stream the soundtrack right now:
CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN //usat.ly/1FIFXhI TOP VIDEOS
